column4: hi guys i need REAL help right now , upgraded my computer from an nforce 4 mobo with athlon 64 3000+ to an nforce 5 with athlon 64x2 5600 and when i tried to boot into ubuntu it freezes but live CD works perfect
please guys help , i dont wanna reinstall ubuntu
you changed your hardware configuration underneath an existing install, which now freezes?
there is a solution other than reinstalling everything?
have you tried booting into safe mode?
yes once in safe mode it works
mycroftiv:but i end having just a prompt
so it sounds like it might just be your xorg settings when trying to start the xserver crashing the machine? did you change video cards?
it should work though cos it's using the same video card from before and the same kernel
i'm not sure how changing your motherboard might affect everything that your startup scripts do, but if you can boot in single user mode to a command prompt your system should be fixable
i know what should i do_ please tell me
from a boot into single user mode you can try sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start    and see if that is where the system has trouble, because that should start your xserver from the command prompt
ok i will try what if it freezes what do i do
well, you might be able to get the terminal back with ctrl-alt-f2 which would tell you if its a hard lockup or just the xserver freezing.
and if it DOES freeze then we know that it IS the video startup taht is causing your issue
